perturbation.original_text: The undersigned hereby agree that the Schedule 13G/A with respect to the shares of Class A Common Stock, $0.001 par value per share, of The RMR Group Inc., dated as of December 31, 2019, is, and any amendments thereto (including amendments on Schedule 13D) signed by each of the undersigned shall be, filed on behalf of each of us pursuant to and in accordance with the provisions of Rule 13d-1(k) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended.
perturbation.changed_text: The undersigned hereby agree that the Schedule 13G/A with respect to the shares of Class A Common Stock, $0.001 par value per share, of The RMR Group Inc., dated as of December 31, 2019, is, and any amendments thereto (including amendments on Schedule 13D) signed by each of the undersigned may be, filed on behalf of each of us pursuant to and in accordance with the provisions of Rule 13d-1(k) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'shall be' to 'may be' introduces ambiguity. The original text mandates the filing, while the modified version makes it optional, conflicting with potential legal requirements for mandatory filings elsewhere.

perturbation.original_text: January 22, 2020 (Date) ABP TRUST /s/ Adam D. Portnoy (Signature) Adam D. Portnoy, President (Name/Title) ADAM D. PORTNOY /s/ Adam D. Portnoy (Signature)
perturbation.changed_text: January 22, 2020 (Date) ABP TRUST /s/ Adam D. Portnoy (Signature) Adam D. Portnoy, CEO (Name/Title) ADAM D. PORTNOY /s/ Adam D. Portnoy (Signature)
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'President' to 'CEO' creates a conflict if the document or related documents specify that only the President has certain signatory authority. This contradiction introduces uncertainty about the validity of the signature.
